creator: andrew.r.bredhauer@transport.qld.gov.au
text:
I'm trying to set a log file name to a value based on a function but at 
runtime the literal function is used in the filename. EG
I have a SimpleDataWriter (or graph results) defined with a filename of 
c:\temp\test_${__javaScript(new Date(),cd)} At runtime I get a log file called 
c:\temp\test_${__javaScript(new Date(),cd)} rather than a time stamped log 
file which is what I'm after. I've tried removing the prefix from the file 
name but that just gives me a file called ${__javaScript(new Date(),cd)} in 
the current directory.

Is this a bug or am I doing something stupid??

Andrew

This is a bug; the listener tries to create the file when functions are not
being expanded.

You can use the -l command file parameter to create a log-file with an arbitrary
name:

jmeter -l yyyymmddhhss.jtl
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
This does not appear to be easy to fix in general.

When running a remote test the controlling JMeter instance only sees the raw
value of the filename, as the testplan has not been scanned to extract function
references.

Changing to LATER

This is the same as bug 25207

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 25207 ***
creator: sebb@apache.org
